intro: Zapoteca portoricensis, commonly known as the Puerto Rican zapoteca, is a flowering plant native to the island of Puerto Rico. It belongs to the Malvaceae family, which includes hibiscus and cotton plants. The plant is characterized by its showy, trumpet-shaped flowers that range in color from white to pink. It typically grows in moist, shaded areas of the island's forests. Due to habitat loss, it is considered a rare and endangered species.
